website_summaries.verdict: The Tracker FG from Vivobarefoot pleases both experts and neophytes on the trail. Its abundance of good qualities is enough to gain people’s approval. Its surprisingly comfy confines, supportive design, and attractive look all add up to its good reputation.However, its lacing system and performance over icy grounds were causes of concern. By and large, the Vivobarefoot Tracker FG can still deliver well on most terrain types. Using it on icy surfaces may appear to be a gamble though.
pros: Based on many customer reviews, the Vivobarefoot Tracker FG is instantly comfortable out of the box
The removable thermal insole of this surprisingly warm hiking boot receives praise from a lot of wearers and gear reviewers
Most owners declare that it is one of the best lightweight hiking boot they owned
The roomy toe box of the Tracker FG delights numerous users
According to a handful of experts, the flexibility of this Vivobarefoot product allows them to maneuver safely and freely
This waterproof boot for hiking earns compliments from several users with its ability to prevent water intrusion
Some hikers mention that it is able to handle diverse terrain effectively
Umpteen wearers appreciate the ankle support of the Tracker FG from Vivobarefoot
Hordes of online buyers and product testers commend the stylish look of this boot for hiking
The majority testifies that it fits as expected
cons: A gear critic is a tad unhappy with the closure system of the Tracker FG
He says that it is a bit of a pain to re-lace and remove the boot because of the lacing hooks
A couple of professional bloggers state that it does not grip well on icy surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mountain leader in the English Lake district and intended to use the boots both around the paths and lanes at home and in the fells. However the sole began to detach after only 6 weeks of light walking. After contacting the manufacturer and supplier with a photo I received no replies. I've since tried a repair with glue. I cannot recommend these boots because neither the product or corresponding customer service are up to scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchole

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, poor quality build
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant boot to wear, but sole began to tear away from upper very quickly. Due to current circumstances, lockdown, the boots have not been used excessively or even to my normal level. However, holes have appeared on both boots at the side where shoes naturally bend and crease. A bit rich in an almost £200 boot. Update on customer service. Downright appalling. Vivobarefoot attempted to shift blame to Amazon. Amazon fulfilled their part of the deal in exemplary fashion. Vivobarefoot are responsible for the manufacture and build of the boots. And that is where the problems occurred.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality leather. Cracking after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality leather and started breakingdown after 3 months of use. I would have expected better quality with the extortionate amount I paid for the boots! . The leather is cracking even with the high upkeep (waxing, removing mud ect...) used for walking the paved street and very minimal hill walk (which is what they are designed for?). Not happy at all with this product. The vivobarefoot trainers are great but would never buy boots again.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: AVOID
customer_reviews.text: An expensive mistake. After 9 months light indoors wear: - sole almost worn through - sides have split well away from the leather in multiple places We contacted customer services several times to try to resolve the issues but they were unhelpful and then simply stopped replying. I saw other reviews with the same problems and ignored them before buying - it was an expensive mistake. I’ve bought from vivobarefoot before but never, ever again. Avoid avoid avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falling appart at the seems after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed that i have only had these shoes for two weeks and they are already coming appart at the sides, also ehen the product arrived, they where scuffed and scratched like someone else had worn them for a couple of weeks and sent them back. When you pay the premium price you expect quality goods, this definitely did not deliver, AVOID THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: alexanderbuck

customer_reviews.title: Better grip on sole is needed but good buy👌
customer_reviews.text: The boot is well made and very comfortable as all vivo barefoot are, but I was disappointed with the sole as regards grip when walking, not so bad on dry ground but as regards wet grassy hills there a nightmare, I slipped twice and landed on my ass my first time walking in them. Other then that great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: poor Quality leather
customer_reviews.text: I paid almost £200.00 for these and the Quality did not meet with my expectations on spending that amount of money.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Jackson

customer_reviews.title: excellent boot
customer_reviews.text: good fit and versatile. very quick delivery. a great birthday present. very comfortable and a good fit.great...thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with these. Great fityi g shoe but very poor quality. Sole came off after only couple of months. Not what you would expect from boots for nearly £200 !!!
customer_reviews.author: Z. Vojackova

customer_reviews.title: Bad review
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots but the sole has began too peel away from the boot, I've owned them for six months and not worn them much at all. I would not recomend for the price that they are at! To be quite Frank I feel as though I've just wasted alot of money
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Style / comfort / fit trifecta.
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable boot I can remember having. Warm , malleable, no breaking in period, perfect fit from the off. And look great.
customer_reviews.author: Ian T.

customer_reviews.title: Had 3 pairs with same manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these boots but sadly I've been massively disappointed. I've never even had chance to wear them around the house yet :( and I've had 3 different pairs through exchanges and they have all had the same problem. There has been imperfections on the footbeds that can be felt when walking I can really notice them after 5 mins in the house :( I have a pair of trainers and I really love them
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

product_meta.title: VIVOBAREFOOT Men's Tracker Firm Ground Walking Shoe
